website_summaries.verdict: You won't find a 4K HDTV as affordable as this LED-backlit model from newcomer Seiki any time soon. The question is, does anyone need 4K right now?

customer_reviews.title: 4k Res at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This works with my Early 2013 Retina Macbook Pro, but not through the HDMI port, I had to get a Mini-Display Port to HDMI adapter that supported 4k. (I got: Cable Matters® Gold Plated Active Mini DisplayPort to HDMI Male to Female Adapter Supporting Eyefinity Technology & 4K Resolution) I did follow the flash instructions to get the 50 inch firmware before hooking my 2013 rMBP, so I don't know if it works with the default firmware.  I do tons of code, email, and enterprise J2ee apps, it is fantastic to have such a large canvas to do things... Youtube at 4k full screen looks good. I can't comment on gaming though.
customer_reviews.author: dmz

customer_reviews.title: This was a great value - IF IT CONTINUES TO WORK
customer_reviews.text: This was a great value - IF IT CONTINUES TO WORK. This set failed with the inability to power on over 3 months ago. After multiple specious questions from the "support" organization, I finally got authorization to send it back - which cost $56 UPS ground. Today the bastards claimed it was damaged in transit and sent pictures that show NOTHING. They said then that the warranty was void. NEVER BUY SEIKI. They are godless bastards who weasel out of any attempt to fix a problem. #neveragain #seikisucks
customer_reviews.author: LCBrevard

customer_reviews.title: I hope its just bad luck but cs from seiki made it seem like ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked Ok for 4 months. Then one day the screen is 100% black. The seiki company says its still under warranty but Now I have to ship it back under my own bill. Then "after four to six weeks you will get an email if they will replace it." Then I will be reasonable to pay for the shipping to get the replacement. I hope its just bad luck but cs from seiki made it seem like this was common.
customer_reviews.author: kirk t holmberg

customer_reviews.title: Either defective TV, or plain terrible unit/design (may have received a used unit)
customer_reviews.text: Either defective TV, or plain terrible unit/design. Connecting it to a top of the line desktop computer (that can handle anything) a flicker would appear in all of my screens (not just the Seiki TV). This happened using all ports, various HDMI cables (proved to work), and at all resolutions (4k 30hz, 1080p, etc). Furthermore, either this TV is packaged by monkeys (ie no quality control), or I received a used unit rather than a new one (and I paid for a new one) .... the box was even missing one of the internal styrofoam pads that go in the corners, and on its place, on that one corner, there was some sort of bubble wrap. Beyond unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best 4k monitor for developers!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very crisp display. I prefer it to my DELL 3008 (2560x1600). The colors are brighter and clear and the text is crisp and clean. Clear-type looks beautiful. Bottom line: I prefer this panel to my more expensive DELL3008 and 30" Cinema Displays. System Requirements * FPS gaming or graphics design... look elsewhere! This is not a color calibrated display. * Your video card must support HDMI 1.3a. (Will stutter otherwise) * Make sure you set the "Sharpness" to 0 in the on-screen-menu.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin

customer_reviews.title: It takes some work, but ok performance for the money
customer_reviews.text: Could these be better? Yes. But with a little work (custom firmware and configuration), these become wonderful monitors and work reasonably well. The minor compromises are made up for having a 39" 120hz 1k or 30hz 4k display. I now have 3 of these being driven by a GTX970 and while again, there are minor annoyances mainly around configuring triple monitor setups, these do a decent job.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive video quality, 30 Hz makes it tough for computer use, IMHO
customer_reviews.text: The screen quality is far above what I expected-- and I was not expecting anything less than "good." The 30 Hz issue unfortunately keeps me from using it as a PC monitor regularly, but I will occasionally when I want to watch 4K video from my own sources or online sources. I've had this for 8 months and I'm still impressed with the picture quality. I've been a life-long video snob since the Sony Trinitron days, and my primary monitor is a color calibrated UltraSharp Dell, so I have some idea of what is good and what isn't. I'd recommend this for a TV and also for a monitor (to use to screen footage, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: TAPDESIGNS

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it sound was not synced. I had to turn off a default setting and then it was okay. Then the next thing was the sound was bad, well the audio options fixed that they have lots of choices. The picture seems pretty good although I don't have anything really to compare it to since we really don't have 4k options yet. Seems like a great buy to me. To all you guys leaving comments about sound and stuff, you should learn about the options before leaving comments
customer_reviews.author: faith

customer_reviews.title: Developed line of red pixels
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these monitors side-by-side on my desk. It is almost like having 4 normal monitors. I do not use them for gaming, but for email, programming, web surfing, etc. they work very well. The price is very good for the quality of the display. Two months after purchasing this monitor, it developed a red line of pixels vertically down the screen. I cannot get them to go away. It is annoying. I still use it for email and the like, but I wish it had not done that.
customer_reviews.author: Grenik

customer_reviews.title: Great for PC work and moderate gaming!
customer_reviews.text: The 39" model is used exclusively as my desktop monitor. Users have claimed there is some lag in FPS games, but I have no issues running this at max resolution in MMO games with all settings on max. This is great for multitasking and coding. I have purchased a second after a few months of daily use on the initial purchase. Some default setting need tinkering with to get it crystal clear (sharpness set to 0) and the advanced settings menu can be reached by pressing the number 0, 5 times on the remote while in the normal menu. Advanced users may wish to alter some settings in there also.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ware

customer_reviews.title: I love the size and resolution
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a computer monitor at work where it has transformed my office. I love the size and resolution. So much more reasonable than buying multiple smaller monitors. Perfect for editing documents and text. Not ideal for graphics and photo editing, the color depth isn't that great. The refresh rate is a little slower than ideal, but it doesn't really bother me for editing documents. Within it's limitations though, this has been one of the best productivity enhancers for me in the past couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: JUNK - Poor (as in none) Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: Junk and no customer support!!!! Read there Facebook page:  Customer support is terrible. I have had my SE39UY04 for only 9 months. First HDMI Input #1 stopped working so I switched to Input #3. The next day my 4k2k signal would not display. I called there technical support line and was on hold for over 45 minutes. Then a recording comes on asking that I go to the website and submit a request. in addition, I also sent an email. It is now 2 weeks later and I have received NO communication!!!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Huge value for programmers/developers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for work (software developer) and it has lived up to every hope and expectation. The power-down thing has been no big deal at all (just press the volume button once and the timer goes away), and the screen real estate has made me the envy of the office. Refresh rate has not been an issue at all, both in terms of on-screen lag as well as with my eyes. If you're a programmer, this is a must-have and the price is astounding.
customer_reviews.author: Tom A.

customer_reviews.title: 4K On a budget.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I know 4K content barely exists. Yes, I know that this panel only supports 30hz. But yes, It's definitely worth it as a computer monitor. This panel can do 240Hz at 720P, 120Hz at 1080P, and supports custom resolutions like 1920x810 for ultra widescreen. At 4K, the monitor works well enough for gaming, but I wouldn't recommend it for first person shooters, or any games that require pinpoint accuracy. At 30Hz Vsync locked, the panel works really well for games like skyrim, where aiming isn't really a twitch requirement. Buy this, enjoy having the equivalent of four 1080P screens on one screen. That's all I can say.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great TV/Monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: I only paid four for this and for that price, it's worth it. I'm using this as a monitor on my computer. This will only do 30Hz at "4k" resolution, so gaming is kind of limited. 1080p upscales and looks kinda weird/dark...which I wasn't expecting, but I bought it for 4k. Does 1080p at 120Hz beautifully. I have a GTX 780 and it barely hangs in there, and I'll probably be getting another to SLI so this plays more smoothly. There is noticeable input lag when on highest resolution, but I can deal with it. About 1/4 second. Would buy again, and I"m considering the 50" model, which can be had at Sears for six.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Reiff

customer_reviews.title: Great as computer monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great as a computer monitor. I have to say I was pretty skeptical about a 4KTV for this ridiculously low price. I am used to using a Apple Thunderbolt display as well as 2 of the terrific 27" Korean no-name displays. The 4K desktop looks amazing, so much so that it's hard to believe for the price! I watched some 4K video on Youtube and that looked excellent as well. Considering a Samsung 55" 4K TV is over $2,000, this is amazing for this low price. Highly recommend. I did not try it as a television so I cannot comment there.
customer_reviews.author: Surfer Bob

customer_reviews.title: perfect as a computer monitor
customer_reviews.text: mine is 39 inch. unboxing and connecting the wires was a breeze. it's nice of seiki to include a HDMI cable in the box. My Nvidia K1000M on windows 7 had difficulty detecting or handling the 4k resolution. I eventually manually set the resolution using information derived from a Linux modeline. Below are the settings. Take off one star for Seiki not making the settings more accessible to users. 3840X2160 H_fporch 48 H_sync 32 H_total 4000 V_fporch 3 V_sync 5 v_total 2222 hz 19
customer_reviews.author: happy mom

customer_reviews.title: Picture Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't ask for a more perfectly clear picture! This takes high def to a new level. I love my music DVDs and you can actually learn how to play guitar because the picture is so crystal clear! My 1080 p can't touch this. The only reason I gave this TV a 4 star rating is that the built in tuner is less than adequate. And unless you get the HD receiver from pay services the lag time is awful. I would get motion sick from watching regular TV. This was a sweet price and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Deanareno

customer_reviews.title: Wow this is extreme
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up to my computer and nothing happened. My old video card could not handle it. So I bought a EVGA GeForce GTX 750Ti Superclock w/G-SYNC Support 2GB Video card and installed it in my computer. This TV/Monitor is awesome with the new video card. I use it as my full time computer monitor. My eyes used to hurt after long hours on my last monitor. With this one they are fine. I can work for many hours. When I'm done working I watch hidef movies on this monitor. The detail is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: UnityInDuality

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Using it as monitor, needed display port to hdmi active converter to get full resolution. Update: 01-28-15 Lately, display drivers are misbehaving more frequently. It used to occur rarely. Screen goes black for 30-60 seconds and comes back by itself. May be it is because of some windows update, thought it is still Win 7 Enterprise 64 bit. Or may be it is the active display-hdmi converter.
customer_reviews.author: Rana

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price I paid
customer_reviews.text: Prices seemed to have risen since I bought this 8 months ago - maybe due to popularity. Anyway, it's been a good monitor. It has some quirks - 1) doesn't go into low power mode right away (30 mins) after the PC is shut off 2) low refresh rate - but I knew that going in The picture is excellent and I have no other issues with it. It has a nice heavy glass stand - not some cheap plastic one. For the price I paid initially, I would recommend it. I got the 39" model.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Great TV, no HDMI 2.0
customer_reviews.text: We love this TV. The OTA HD broadcasts are great. Anything HD\1080P is very sharp and bright. It is amazing how you can see so much more detail. One thing I wasn't aware of is this TV does not support HDMI 2.0 only 1.4. This means it will only support a 4K resolution of 3840 x 2160 pixels at 24, 25 and 30Hz or full 4K (4096 x 2160 pixels) at 24Hz. At this time it isn't a big issue but others may want to know this before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E.

customer_reviews.title: It was a great TV for 3 years
customer_reviews.text: It was a great TV for 3 years...but now it takes 5 minutes of turning it off and on until we finally get a picture. It's likely not really even safe to leave on. We have a Samsung TV that's more than 10 years old and still working. Not going to by a Seiki again.
customer_reviews.author: blugirl

customer_reviews.title: Very good TV for the price (at the time of purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good TV for the price (at the time of purchase in 2014, most 4K TVs in this size were upwards of $800, making this a steal). this is NOT a smart TV. its just a regular led tv with 4k resolution. I've observed it under some taxing scenarios (such as soundspectrum g-force music visualizations, 4k nature videos with lots of black/vivid color). If you pay close attention, the led backlighting is noticeable when you have black sections.
customer_reviews.author: Adi

customer_reviews.title: hate that it does not have a digitial tuner built ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple, no frills, hate that it does not have a digitial tuner built in (really!?!!?), but the image is impactful....for the price, you cannot beat it. Never tried it as a computer monitor, but I read that it's not bad....just a tad too large for me in that regard. If you're looking to keep things very, very simple, this might just be a cheap way to enter into the 4k arena. No regrets other than the tuner. Roger
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of GARBAGE!!!! Died After Warranty. Do not Buy anything from this company or you'll be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin E. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good TV, too laggy to be used as a computer monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great resolution, but the display is too laggy for me to comfortably use it with my 2012 retina macbook pro. It may work great with newer models but the original retina just can't push the pills fast enough to provide a smooth mouse movement experience. Some folks don't mind the lag so YMMV but it was a deal breaker for me when trying to use this as a computer monitor. Fortunately it still makes for a great TV so it wasn't a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 4K monitor
customer_reviews.text: I really like this TV. I use it for a second monitor for my computer. I also have feeds from my PS3 and cable so it is a multipurpose. As a monitor it works very well because of the high resolution. I can get a lot of different windows organized and open on the screen. This allows me to use my main monitor to work from as I gather data from the open screens. This TV was recommended to me by several tech podcasts and I haven't been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not sure you can do better for the price
customer_reviews.text: For a display that is pretty much the same price as a 1080p tv of comparable size, why not go for twice the resolution? Well, if you're going to use it as a computer display, like I am. It takes a little while to calibrate the color, but it looks great once you do. I'm using a late 2011 macbook pro, and the display is connected to HDMI via an Accell Mini DisplayPort 1.1 to HDMI 1.4 Active Adapter, which is at the end of a daisy-chain of two external hard drives. I got all the available resolutions up to 4k right away, no problem!
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Seiki SUCKS.
customer_reviews.text: This TV lasted 2 weeks. Yesterday I was watching TV with my son who is 7. I heard a loud pop from the TV and smoke started billowing out the back of the TV. I unplugged the TV and grabbed a fire extinguisher in case I needed it. I had my son help me lift the TV off the mantelpiece where I had it set up. We were prepared to take it outside should it continue smoking but fortunately once the power was turned off the fire went out. Naturally my son was shaken up, as was I. Now I just need to figure out how to return it as I threw away the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: martin gueulette

customer_reviews.title: Everyone, run and download Quartz Debug, and turn ...
customer_reviews.text: Everyone, run and download Quartz Debug, and turn off Beam Sync. Wow, the lag is gone, running 3 4K displays, two of them are the 39" Seiki, with 50" Firmware, totally introduced crazy lag, was unusable! Working with the 26" Dell 4k as well, so could see the crazy lag that was killing my CAD work. Read through many posts and came across this tip: download the Graphics Tools from Apple Developer and just keep Quartz Debug running all the time. Wow, changed my life!
customer_reviews.author: mmwwsss

customer_reviews.title: OMG - LOVE LOVE LOVE!!
customer_reviews.text: 3840x2160 - do I really need to say any more? 2 1080p monitors were starting to get too small for me. Enter this awesome solution - great price if you are not a huge gamer. 30hz is probably too slow for 1st person shooter games, but for having multiple office apps and such open and visible at once, this can't be beat. Diablo 3 is ok with 30hz - OCCASIONALLY lose track of the cursor, but for less than $500 this cannot be beat for the resolution it has.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: TV good, but is affected by cable remote.
customer_reviews.text: The TV is great, and has a great picture, however, my verizon fios does not have a compatible code for it and when I use my fios remote control, the volume on the tv is affected and there does not seem to be any way to stop the fios remote from interacting with the tv.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Grower

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a 4k tv, reeeeaaalllllly crappy speakers.
customer_reviews.text: I would give this TV 5 stars absolutely. It is the best 4k tv price I have found at the time that I am posting this. The screen is really fantastic. With that being said, the only reason I am giving this TV a 4 star is because it has absolutely horrible speakers. Buy this TV for the Screen, not the speakers, and you will be super happy. (However, 4k TV prices are coming down every day so my comments are probably only valid for about 6 months)
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Great for computer monitor!!!!1
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this only for a few days, and there are some glitchy things...nothing major, mind you....it just will power down from time to time, based on it's supposition that it is a TV and no one is paying attention to it. I assume that this is easily fixed in the settings...no matter....the picture is beautiful!!! I am using as a monitor for my mac and I couldn't be more pleased!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Cottrell

customer_reviews.title: exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money, after meticulously tweaking video and audio settings, it's a good buy, sharp vivid picture and bright colors. I keep it at 1080p. For my Xbox 360 and Netflix. Note: the audio is terrible until you adjust the settings. I recommend leaving surround sound off( it sounds hollow when on) and put it on the "music" preset.
customer_reviews.author: caleb harmon

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck no doubt
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for your buck no doubt. It's 30hz, but all movies and tv content is only around 26.6hz soooo yeah. Its the sharpest tv I've ever owned and the largest and it was only $340 Too slow for gaming or use as a computer monitor, but for watching movies and tv its great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Strong

customer_reviews.title: Using as a monitor - a Helpful Tip to fix Windows moving all your content around on power off
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews here are pretty spot on, and used as a monitor, it runs great as long as you follow many of the other suggestions. ***NOTE*** For those using this is in a multi-monitor setup, and having the issue where in WIndows it moves all your applications and icons to your other screen when it shuts off or goes into power save mode, there is a solution for that, it involves just a little piece of tape on the HDMI cable which will prevent windows from detecting when the display goes away. More info here (Scroll towards the bottom, lots of pictures and info). [...]
customer_reviews.author: Richard Smerker

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing. 4k is super sharp and you'll never want ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. 4k is super sharp and you'll never want to go back. Get it as a monitor. 39" may seem huge at first but pretty soon you'll be used to multitasking with 2 research windows and your paper open at the same time. Everybody will want to watch movies on your screen. You won't regret your purchase. Just make sure your computer can output 4k first.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse P

customer_reviews.title: Far from perfect, but... $329!?
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it has a crappy stand and remote. Yes, the customer service hung up on me twice. Yes, the 4k is limited to 30 Hz. True, the instructions for firmware updates on their site are totally wrong. The uniformity leaves something to be desired. So why the 4 stars? It is a 4k tv.. for $329. If you intend to use it as a computer monitor, this is a no brainer. 4k content looks stunning.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Great 4K tv for the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent 1080p, blu-rays look really nice on it but finding 4K content is nearly impossible because not many players or Blu-ray players play 4K. I wall-mounted my TV it looks really nice. Great price for the size. I would recommend this TV to anybody that wants a simple TV that plays 1080P movies at 60 frames a second(Hz). When 4K content comes around I am pretty sure this TV would be the bomb!!
customer_reviews.author: Abramov

customer_reviews.title: SEIKI is a major disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: Don't but this TV! Not even with an extended warranty. It flashes off for 1 second for no apparent reason every hour. I've sent the TV back and the company sent me another one....Guess what? It flicks on and off too! It's been tested with different sources too (Sony PS3 and Apple TV). I'm stuck with the disco tv from hell because I'm ethical and will not sell it to some unknowing buyer.
customer_reviews.author: Cedric Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nice resolution!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this TV. I use it as a monitor for my computer. My old intel-4000 graphics card was not capable of driving it at 4k, but my other systems all can. It is really nice how much I can have open, and how much room there is for window placement. At 4k it will only use 30hz, so far this has only been a problem in making ti hard to locate my mouse cursor. Fullscreen video from youtube is also somewhat flickery. The only real downsides are these: * The width makes it feel somewhat awkward looking at things near the edges. * No extra features like PIP, or netflix/apps
customer_reviews.author: Chad Granum

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor at an excellent price($339)
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor at an excellent price. Text was not sharp till the firmware is updated to the 50" version and sharpness turned down to zero. Had crashes in Win8.1 with AMD catalyst 14.9 with dual 7950 in crossfire mode. No problem at all with Catalyst 13.12. Use a high speed HDMI cable (not the one included) and plug into HDMI1 port to avoid problems. TV tuner sensitivity is very good but switching inputs will cause the icons to be moved the other displays.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Ting

customer_reviews.title: Great TV low cost
customer_reviews.text: For the cost of the item you get a great TV that up scales video. I have placed this TV right next to my Sharp 55" TV and the picture on this TV is much crisper and the colors appear deeper. It is great. Be careful what HDMI cable you attempt to connect to a video source as not all of them are capable of sending higher resolution video.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Great tv great deal
customer_reviews.text: Good tv. Not being an average techie, I kinda knew what I was getting before hand, but that said, I wasn't disappointed. I use it for pc. Its crystal clear and I've only earned myself one stick pixel. Guess that's a win with this technology in itself. There is nothing yet really available in terms of you wanting to watch something, but if you game, and can tolerate the 30hz refresh you may have to use,this is for you. Warning. It will spoil you when viewing photos on your desktop, so be prepared to go scour the internet for 4k backdrops
customer_reviews.author: Jon Parker

customer_reviews.title: Terrible TV, terrible Monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Useless as a TV for a Roku or PS4 (No 4K/HDCP2.2 support), useless as a computer monitor (super laggy, 4k only works at 30hz).
customer_reviews.author: C Lily

customer_reviews.title: I'm going to keep this short and sweet. This is an incredible looking TV
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to keep this short and sweet. This is an incredible looking TV. I am thoroughly impressed with the contrast as well as the thin bezel and high definition picture. The only real DRAWBACK to this TV that I have found is its poor audio output as the lack of 4K streaming devices is somewhat irrelevant to this product and will likely change in the near future. I would recommend this product to anyone who is prepared to buy an alternate audio device and modern media player capable of outputting at 4K.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lisenby

customer_reviews.title: Great computer monitor. The connections/cables are a generation early.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device at a superb price. The picture is fantastic. The major problem with it is that it doesn't have a display port in, and is stuck with Hdmi 1.4. That means that the max refresh rate is stuck at 30 htz. I'm using it as a monitor and it's great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Ben G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the money. I use this as a computer monitor and occasionally as a TV. I use suggestions of previous evaluators to change the factory settings. 4K downloaded videos are alright, but nothing special to my eye. There were some problems with some previously installed software and browsers crashing. However, this was resolved when my video card software was removed and then updated and reinstalled. Therefore, I concluded it was a result of the video card outdated software.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Draper

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. DO NOT waste your money on the Seiki brand. Purchased the 39" and it worked for 12 weeks. Seiki wanted me to pay over $100 for shipping their bad product to them and would not pick up or allow a drop off. Ridiculous business model. Please, do not waste your money on this brand.
customer_reviews.author: dentonjw

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Nice display
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Nice display. Using it as a computer monitor. Display died after 6 months (power supply failed) company replaced it with a slightly different model that was larger (42") but not as good specs. (4K/30Hz/1 HDMI/etc vs 4K/120Hz/4 HDMI/etc) That was only option. So, not happy with lower quality display replacement. Seiki was ok to deal with otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: 260 works for me also using a RedDragon mouse lot better than what i was using (Logitec) MX series Its ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what their going for now 350.00? paid 500.00 for mine use it on my gaming PC I use firmware baseline ver: 260 works for me also using a RedDragon mouse lot better than what i was using (Logitec) MX series Its way worth the money if you get it for 350.00 BUT a lot of tweekin involved..
customer_reviews.author: bobwire

customer_reviews.title: Value for money with limits
customer_reviews.text: An Excellent computer monitor for the value, with limited controls. I wish it had a better software to calibrate colors. As a TV, the best you can get in the market place. There is no other 4k TV at this price point. To bad that one cannot truly test the 4K capabilities due to limited content. The sound quality is subpar. It can use external speakers to enhance the experience. Bottom line, it delivered on what was promised--4K computer monitor and no frill 1080p tv.
customer_reviews.author: James Plano

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful for the purposes I intended
customer_reviews.text: Extremely useful for the purposes I intended, but it keeps shutting down every few hours and I have to turn it on again. When I turn it on, all my windows are in the wrong place. Still, for the price, it was quite a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Fink

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but fails in less that 400 days.
customer_reviews.text: lasted just over a year. Make sure you get square trade if you buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Interscape

customer_reviews.title: When the price was $399 I should have purchased two
customer_reviews.text: My macbook pro can drive this display and give me a 4K desktop. for the money it has a much superior display than my plasma 720p or my more modern lcd display. At the new price of $499 I would rate it 4 stars for the following reasons. 1) it does not have a displayport input 2) only 4K at 30hz 3) the menu is a wee bit spartan.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Browne

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice and clear picture, great for programming. I wish it had power management over HDMI capabilities, but what can I say, its $350. I'm using it with my Surface pro 3 with the Accell active adapter and with my larger laptop. No problems so far
customer_reviews.author: Elliot Matson

customer_reviews.title: Works very nicely combined with a program like DisplayFusion that helps set ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat it for the price, using it as pc monitor with Windows 8.1. Works very nicely combined with a program like DisplayFusion that helps set macros to move windows to specific areas of the screen. Doesn't sleep and wake up like a normal monitor so I have to manually turn it back on but for the price of a 4K monitor it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Rader

customer_reviews.title: It Awesome Color jump out at you clear and you forget ...
customer_reviews.text: Took the TV out of the box exactly how it was advertised I was replacing my 55" Samsung in my bedroom to place it in my day room. I was skeptical about it never heard the name. Yet it was so clear and in stead of it being 4k 30hz 1080p 120hz it 4k 60hz 1080p 120hz. It Awesome Color jump out at you clear and you forget how small it is ( This meaning that the TV it was replacing was a 55 inch so it was small at first to me) yet you for get right away. It Worth it for what you pay for it's a highway robbery to the company lol ... Great TV
customer_reviews.author: Alex pena

customer_reviews.title: great monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Needed for spreadsheet work, light CAD and manipulating PDF. I was previously working with 1080 monitors and figured I'd try a 4k 27" and then I saw this for the same price. How could I go wrong. I don't know how I worked without this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: i use it as a computer monitor and i like it a lot. It would be even better if it was just a monitor and not a TV. Computer will not switch it on/off i'm doing this with my remote. Also the TV will try to power off when it thinks that it was inactive long enough, even when you keep using your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Peter G.

customer_reviews.title: Very good computer monitor
customer_reviews.text: It is working great as a computer monitor at 4k resolution. In case you haven't had time to do much research I'll give you the important notes: 1. You will only get 30hz (frames per second) at 4k resolution 2. You can run at 1080p 120hz for gaming purposes if you'd like 3. It is perfectly crisp and looks great, after making appropriate adjustments (set sharpness to 0) 4. Make sure the specs for your video card indicate it can handle the resolution 5. 30hz really doesn't look bad at all for normal desktop use. Some animations may look slightly less fluid than you are used to.
customer_reviews.author: SKG

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality 4k TV Catches Fire!
customer_reviews.text: Caught on fire after 3 years. It was out of warranty by the time but I did not expect it to burn down my house either! It was lucky as I was around and saw smoke coming off the back and prevented a major incident.
customer_reviews.author: R8

customer_reviews.title: not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: tv is a-ok picture quality is great . everything is great when watching 4k tv far as games go it's not bad, playing in 4k. really nice picture . even if it is at 30 fps I played bf4 and nfs rivals and it played very good , but I credit my pc power and fios connection also... I took video of bf4 and nfs , and it looks good I used my cell phone to recored video cause I didn't have a in game record, fraps would not startup in game.. now how do I upload video ?hmm
customer_reviews.author: J. night

customer_reviews.title: up until then it was a great tv for a cheap price
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a solid year before it simply stopped working for an unknown reason, up until then it was a great tv for a cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Lively

customer_reviews.title: Great price, excellent unit if you add a sound system
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome TV for the price, the sound quality on the unit is VERY POOR, I added the Visio bar surround sound system and now could not be happier. For the money even after adding the sound sys. It's a great deal. The picture is supreme.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great starter 4k TV
customer_reviews.text: Had this a week now. Crystal clear picture at 4k, when having my media pc connected watching the limited 4k media available. Still great at 1080p. Exactly what I expected. Sound quality isnt great, but I expected to be connecting it to my surround sound receiver, which through the optical cable works perfectly. For the price and size this is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel  Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works on a Macbook Pro Early 2011
customer_reviews.text: Just received the screen (39" version). Mounted the base, put it on the desk, connected the HDMI cable to a HDMI to mini display port adapter, and that's it: 3840 x 2160 resolution at 30Hz. Too early to give a more thorough review but my Early 2011 MBP with a AMD Radeon HD 6750M 1024 MB video card on OS10.9.1 works 100% out of the box. Color calibration will obviously be necessary, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for college dorm to drive a X-Box (check that ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for college dorm to drive a X-Box (check that works), as a monitor for my HP Envy laptop (nope-signal not compatible) and as a TV using a wall cable ie no cable box or sat receiver. It seems that Seiki doesn't put QAM tuner into their Ultra 4k TVs. Seiki took numerous emails and calls most of which contained contradicting info. This TV is very sharp for a 40 inch flat screen, but the lack of capability without warning or adequate support makes it a dog for many. So let this be your warning.
customer_reviews.author: Machiavelli

customer_reviews.title: Good for everything, but PC FPS's
customer_reviews.text: Great for watching movies, great for playing Xbox 360, and great for PC strategy games. The fast pace shooters, Titanfall, Call of Duty, etc, can run just it obviously feels a little off. My graphics cards (Dual GTX 680s) struggle with some games sometimes, but usually can play anything.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: other times it works fine.
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a computer monitor. Only issue I've had is it gets times where the picture wants to cut off for a few seconds at a time. Issue seems to come and go, other times it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Murray

customer_reviews.title: Good TV for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good TV for the price...good color just update the BIOS to bring it out...easy to do
customer_reviews.author: M. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Replaced 3 monitors with this one. It works!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Great monitor. I replaced 3 x 24" screens running 1920x1200 tilted vertical with one of these 4K guys running 3840x2100. I use it for software development not games. Its really nice to have that much real estate with no breaks. Looking forward to Windows 10 with its utilities for handling 4k screens. Oh, I had to get a new video card but all I needed was a GeForce GTX 750 under $200.
customer_reviews.author: Archie Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart TV. Beautiful picture and wifi for Netflix and Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have a modern TV in front of my treadmill while I work out. It's a smart TV that lets me connect to wifi. I'm able to watch Netflix and Amazon Prime shows while putting miles in on the treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: C Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Good PC monitor
customer_reviews.text: Turning this monitor on is becoming an issue. You hit the power button on the remote or the back and then wait ten seconds to see if it worked. You have to do this up to ten times. It was good for about two years.
customer_reviews.author: robgrza

customer_reviews.title: once calibrated it looks amazing. There is slight mouse lag but you can ...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for my main computer screen, once calibrated it looks amazing. There is slight mouse lag but you can get used to that. Replaced my 2 30" samsung monitors with this one and have been very happy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Alley

customer_reviews.title: Several flaws, but extremely low price makes up for it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a monitor, not as a TV. The default settings are terrible (i.e. the "sharpness" setting), and the colors is weird - but one you spend a while tweaking it, and once you do a firmware update, the color is okay. I thought the 30hz refresh rate (at 4K resolution) would be problematic for videos, but I actually don't really notice it. The only remaining issue is that, for some reason, the monitor doesn't wake up when it gets an HDMI signal, so I have to explicitly turn it on every time I start using the computer.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great value but you do have to get into the weeds with it.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: This TV is amazing it has extremely loud speakers so even at 1 it's a little too loud. The definition in the screen is remarkable and is 3D also I would recommend this purchase to anyone if you're cheap and want something that's high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Newman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this as my main monitor for my home office. It works perfectly as a monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Banville

customer_reviews.title: Excellent code developer monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 2 24 inch 1080 monitors with this TV and can fit 4 1920 x 1080 views on one screen. Much easier than swiveling head back and forth between 3 monitors :)
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Awesome desktop monitor if you use it as one
customer_reviews.text: I would tell people to avoid this if you are strictly using it for the 4k on a Desktop. If you're just going to watch films etc at 4k, than no problamo. Programmers will be fine with the low refresh at 4k but any real visual enthusiast will probably run the display at 1080p at 120hz ( which looks glorious! ) Such a good deal for a 39 in 4k screen. Yea it doesn't have 60hz 4k, but it's also not 27 inch and as a 1080p 120hz display at 39 inches, I think it already pays for itself and then includes 4k to boot if you wanted to watch 4k Youtube, Netflix etc.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas S

customer_reviews.title: garbage, I havent even used it for 5 years and it broke the other day
customer_reviews.text: this is ridiculous, over $850 and the thing wont power on, i think it is the power supply and hope it can be fixed. i think i need to contact seiki. any advice anybody?
customer_reviews.author: anthony lorenzi

customer_reviews.title: Great Value but the AMH 39" much better
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor for the price but for better color and quality, I paid an extra $100 and ordered the AMH. I tried to return this but it was going to cost $125.00 shipping so I decided to keep this and use as a TV.
customer_reviews.author: Claudehopper

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful TV. I tried using it as a monitor ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful TV. I tried using it as a monitor but there was a slight delay which was driving me crazy so I moved it upstairs to use as a TV. Yes, I tried the various firmwares and settings.
customer_reviews.author: Meir

customer_reviews.title: 4k video at very competitive cost; audio is downright awful
customer_reviews.text: This not the best 4k monitor out there - I have several better ones in the lab but this one is definitely the most cost effective. Do not expect much out of the audio though; any audio we feed into this thing sounds like it is coming across two muffled tin cans on a string.
customer_reviews.author: RandomAccessNothing

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat it for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Good for 4K video and as a super huge desktop for your Macbook Pro Retina. Not for gaming at all though. I can edit photos on this really nicely but refer to my MacBook Pro Retina's display for correct colors.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works great with gaming consoles but laptops with dual graphics cards ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great with gaming consoles but laptops with dual graphics cards (one for standard use, one for gaming in my case) tend to not be able to use a HDMI cables without having advanced knowledge of how to default the stronger one directly to the OS.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My first time writing a review on Amazon. This 65 inch 4K TV is awesome. Picture quality is very good and we are all amazed. As one reviewer said we will never go back to standard HD TV. If you are worried about the unheard brand name, purchase of an extended service warranty might be helpful—I did that and don’t think it’s expensive. Overall, a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Meh. It's ok, shows potential
customer_reviews.text: Light leakage and definitely not as good as I expected. 4k isn't quite there yet and this is a new, cheaper company, so expect as much. Potential for a good future, as the prices are great, but quality has to catch up.
customer_reviews.author: Some Cool Dude

customer_reviews.title: Works really well as a work monitor, able to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well as a work monitor, able to game with it in 1080p or 1440p. Had issues connecting to surface pro - requires an active adapter and all the troubles associated with that.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bohlmann

customer_reviews.title: Works great, sound is good
customer_reviews.text: Works great, sound is good, will see how it looks when I upgrade video card to 4k., would have been better if it had a higher refreash at 4k, but for price it is great.
customer_reviews.author: J.  R. P.

customer_reviews.title: Great computer monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Using it as a computer monitor. I can only get 30Hz refresh rate with my computer, which makes it a hair laggy, but contrast and colors are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nowak

customer_reviews.title: nice tv for the price but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I initially loved the tv for the price and didn't need anything special since I already had a Roku. BUT, It's a good thing I bought the Square Trade warranty because at 16mos (4 mos post warranty), 1/2 the screen went dim (from top to middle) making it difficult to watch. Great little tv otherwise. Square Trade is replacing
customer_reviews.author: spree0610

customer_reviews.title: Pretty upsetting. Past the year mark for warranty of ...
customer_reviews.text: For a cheap TV it is probably worth it. Recently though have run into ghosting. When the screen goes from a light image to black, I can still see the light image but slightly faded out. Pretty upsetting. Past the year mark for warranty of course.
customer_reviews.author: David Spansel

customer_reviews.title: Looks really great on Blu-ray video
customer_reviews.text: It works very well with my desk top computer. Dose not have a digital tuner. To view digital programing you will have to a convert box of some kind. Looks really great on Blu-ray video.
customer_reviews.author: Roy R. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Volume too loud, slow when turning on and changing inputs
customer_reviews.text: I like this TV because its the only 4K one in the $500 price range. However, there are 2 issue that would make me return the product if there were other ones available for around the same price. The sound on the TV is way too loud, even on its lowest setting. The 1 setting on this TV sounds like a 10-15 on other TVs I owned. The other issue it takes forever for the TV to turn on. I saw other reviews say the same thing, but did not expect it to be this long. I timed it with a stopwatch and it took 27 seconds to turn on. Most of my other TVs take about 8 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Top1105

customer_reviews.title: Bargain
customer_reviews.text: wow, great picture, great bargain for a UHDTV. I hooked my iPad Air up to it and the picture was stunning. Saturated colors and smooth picture.
customer_reviews.author: Cpt Roland Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Macbook Pro circa early 2013 + Mavericks = worked OOTB
customer_reviews.text: I had to upgrade the OSX version to Mavericks, but once that worked, the 39" immediately went to 30Hz 3184 x 2160. Looks pretty good. Turning contrast down seemed to help too. Currently using this for coding not for gaming. Really wish OSX had built-in mouse radar and/or mouse trails. It's so big the mouse pointer is hard to locate.
customer_reviews.author: constance eustace

product_meta.title: Seiki SE39UY04 39-Inch 4K Ultra HD 120Hz LED TV (Discontinued)
product_meta.description:
Get a high class viewing experience with the Seiki SE39UY04 39" Class (38.5" Diagonal) LED 4K/2K Ultra HDTV. It delivers sharp stunning lifelike images at 3840 x 2160 resolution. The screen refresh rate of 60Hz and response time of 6.5 ms offers sharp picture quality during fast action visuals. The 5000:1 contrast ratio ensures to give out perfect shades for darker and lighter scene. Order the Seiki SE39UY04 39" Class (38.5" Diagonal) LED 4K/2K Ultra HDTV now!

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Dimensions (W x H x D): TV without stand: 35.16'' x 21.21" x 3.48'', TV with stand: 35.16'' x 23.33'' x 7.87''

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars799 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
